description.value:
When you hit with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal 2d8 extra &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage to the target plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st (max 5d8) and plus 1d8 against &Reference[undead]{undead} or fiends.
More Details

Starting at 2nd level, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage to the target, in addition to the weapon’s damage. The extra damage is 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 5d8. The damage increases by 1d8 if the target is an undead or a &Reference[fiend]{fiend}, to a maximum of 6d8.

Healing energy radiates from you in an aura with a 30-foot radius. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. You can use a bonus action to cause one creature in the aura (including you) to regain 2d6 hit points.

system.chatFlavor: [2d6 - healing] You can use a bonus action to target one creature in the aura (including you)

description.value:
The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your weapon flares with a bright light, and the attack deals an extra 3d8 &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw or be &Reference[blinded]{blinded} until the spell ends.

A creature &Reference[blinded]{blinded} by this spell makes another &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer &Reference[blinded]{blinded}.

system.chatFlavor: [3d8 - radiant] The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration

description.value:
The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon gleams with astral radiance as you strike. The attack deals an extra 2d6 &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage to the target, which becomes visible if it is &Reference[invisible]{invisible}, and the target sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and can’t become &Reference[invisible]{invisible} until the spell ends. 

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

system.chatFlavor: [2d6 - radiant] The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends

description.value:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is &Reference[undead]{undead}, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls &Reference[prone]{prone} and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

macro.name: Command
macro.author: roRDywD19pu2VxlC

description.value:
You attempt to compel a creature into a duel. One creature that you can see within range must make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is drawn to you, compelled by your divine demand. For the duration, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than you, and must make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw each time it attempts to move to a space that is more than 30 feet away from you; if it succeeds on this saving throw, this spell doesn’t restrict the target’s movement for that turn.

The spell ends if you attack any other creature, if you cast a spell that targets a hostile creature other than the target, if a creature friendly to you damages the target or casts a harmful spell on it, or if you end your turn more than 30 feet away from the target.

You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

activation.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell

description.value: Holy power radiates from you in an aura with a 30-foot radius, awakening boldness in friendly creatures. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. While in the aura, each nonhostile creature in the aura (including you) deals an extra 1d4 &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage when it hits with a weapon attack.

system.chatFlavor: [1d4 - radiant] When each nonhostile creature within the aura hits with an attack

description.value:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

You summon a spirit that assumes the form of an unusually intelligent, strong, and loyal steed, creating a long-lasting bond with it. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the steed takes on a form that you choose: a warhorse, a pony, a camel, an elk, or a mastiff. (Your GM might allow other animals to be summoned as steeds.) The steed has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a &Reference[celestial]{celestial}, &Reference[fey]{fey}, or &Reference[fiend]{fiend} (your choice) instead of its normal type. Additionally, if your steed has an &Reference[int]{Intelligence} of 5 or less, its &Reference[int]{Intelligence} becomes 6, and it gains the ability to understand one language of your choice that you speak.

Your steed serves you as a mount, both in combat and out, and you have an instinctive bond with it that allows you to fight as a seamless unit. While mounted on your steed, you can make any spell you cast that targets only you also target your steed.

When the steed drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. You can also dismiss your steed at any time as an action, causing it to disappear. In either case, casting this spell again summons the same steed, restored to its hit point maximum.

While your steed is within 1 mile of you, you can communicate with each other telepathically.

You can't have more than one steed bonded by this spell at a time. As an action, you can release the steed from its bond at any time, causing it to disappear.

A willing creature you touch is imbued with bravery. Until the spell ends, the creature is immune to being &Reference[frightened]{frightened} and gains temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of its turns. When the spell ends, the target loses any remaining temporary hit points from this spell.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

Choose a &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or be &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

materials.value: a small, straight piece of iron

description.value:
You create a twisting pattern of colors that weaves through the air inside a 30-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who sees the pattern must make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes &Reference[charmed]{charmed} for the duration. While &Reference[charmed]{charmed} by this spell, the creature is &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated} and has a speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

materials.value: a glowing stick of incense or a crystal vial filled with phosphorescent material

description.value: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, &Reference[fey]{fey}, fiends, and &Reference[undead]{undead}.

The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can't be &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, or possessed by them. If the target is already &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

materials.value: holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes

description.value:
You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball.

If the warded creature makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy, or deals damage to another creature, this spell ends.

The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during the spell’s duration, your weapon flares with white-hot intensity, and the attack deals an extra 1d6 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage to the target and causes the target to ignite in flames. At the start of each of its turns until the spell ends, the target must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 1d6 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage. On a successful save, the spell ends. If the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to put out the flames, or if some other effect douses the flames (such as the target being submerged in water), the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial extra damage dealt by the attack increases by 1d6 for each slot.

system.chatFlavor: [1d6 - fire] Initial Damage, [1d6 - fire] At the start of each of the target's turns until the spell ends

description.value: A shimmering field appears and surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

materials.value: a small parchment with a bit of holy text written on it

description.value:
You magically distract the triggering creature and turn its momentary uncertainty into encouragement for another creature. The triggering creature must reroll the d20 and use the lower roll.

You can then choose a different creature you can see within range (you can choose yourself). The chosen creature has advantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes within 1 minute. A creature can be empowered by only one use of this spell at a time.

activation.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself succeeds on an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw

description.value:
You call forth spirits of the dead, which flit around you for the spell’s duration. The spirits are intangible and invulnerable.

Until the spell ends, any attack you make deals 1d8 extra damage when you hit a creature within 10 feet of you. This damage is &Reference[radiant]{radiant}, &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic}, or &Reference[cold]{cold} (your choice when you cast the spell). Any creature that takes this damage can’t regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

In addition, any creature of your choice that you can see that starts its turn within 10 feet of you has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above 3rd.

The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your weapon rings with &Reference[thunder]{thunder} that is audible within 300 feet of you, and the attack deals an extra 2d6 &Reference[thunder]{thunder} damage to the target. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

system.chatFlavor: [2d6 - thunder] The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration

description.value:
You point at one creature you can see within range, and the sound of a dolorous bell fills the air around it for a moment. The target must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or take 1d8 &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic} damage. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes 1d12 &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic} damage.

The spell’s damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level (2d8 or 2d12), 11th level (3d8 or 3d12), and 17th level (4d8 or 4d12).

system.chatFlavor: [1d8 - necrotic] The die type becomes a d12 if the target is missing any of its hit points.

description.value:
This spell wards a willing creature you touch and creates a mystic connection between you and the target until the spell ends. While the target is within 60 feet of you, it gains a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws, and it has resistance to all damage. Also, each time it takes damage, you take the same amount of damage.

The spell ends if you drop to 0 hit points or if you and the target become separated by more than 60 feet. It also ends if the spell is cast again on either of the connected creatures. You can also dismiss the spell as an action.

materials.value: a pair of platinum rings worth at least 50 gp each, which you and the target must wear for the duration

description.value: The next time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration, your attack deals an extra 1d6 &Reference[psychic]{psychic} damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or be &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of you until the spell ends. As an action, the creature can make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} check against your spell save DC to steel its resolve and end this spell.

system.chatFlavor: [1d6 - psychic] The next time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell’s duration

description.value:
You create a magical zone that guards against &Reference[dec]{deception} in a 15-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on a point of your choice within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a &Reference[cha]{Charisma} saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can't speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether each creature succeeds or fails on its saving throw.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.

biography.value:
Backstory

Cast out of the Elven community because of his love for my human mother, my father built a small cottage in the forest. An evil troll killed my parents and destroyed our home. He planned to keep me as his slave, but I escaped. With no place to go, I wandered the streets trying to survive. I met another young urchin, a human named Xander. He helped me survive and taught me to play the lute and the lyre. We spent years together on the streets, but I woke up one day to find him gone without a word.
biography.public:
Backstory

Cast out of the Elven community because of his love for my human mother, my father built a small cottage in the forest. An evil troll killed my parents and destroyed our home. He planned to keep me as his slave, but I escaped. With no place to go, I wandered the streets trying to survive. I met another young urchin, a human named Xander. He helped me survive and taught me to play the lute and the lyre. We spent years together on the streets, but I woke up one day to find him gone without a word.

details.trait: I like to squeeze into small places where no one else can get to me.
details.ideal: Respect. All people, rich or poor, deserve respect. (Good)
details.bond: I owe my survival to another urchin who taught me to live on the streets.
details.flaw:
I will never fully trust anyone other than myself.
It’s not stealing if I need it more than someone else.
